Consumption Rate.name: Consumption Rate
Consumption Rate.description: Consumption rates describe the billing rate for a range of usage within a consumption schedule. All consumption schedules require at least one consumption rate in order to rate usage on a usage product.

ConsumptionScheduleId.description: The consumption schedule that contains the consumption rate.

CurrencyIsoCode.description: Available only for orgs with the multicurrency feature enabled.

LowerBound.description: The lowest quantity of usage for the consumption rate.

Name.description: Required. Default name of this record. Label is Product Name.

Price.description: The price for usage that falls within the consumption rate’s bounds.

PricingMethod.description: How Salesforce applies the consumption rate’s price to the total quantity of usage within a usage summary.

ProcessingOrder.description: The order for processing the usage rate across multiple rates. Consumption rates are evaluated beginning with the lowest processing order.

UpperBound.description: The highest quantity of usage for the consumption rate.
